newsitem.title: CANADA: SW Saskatchewan, mid-Alberta saw slight frost risk.
newsitem.headline: SW Saskatchewan, mid-Alberta saw slight frost risk.

text.p: Southwest Saskatchewan's Parkland area and mid-Alberta's Red Deer area saw two hours of a slight risk of frost Friday, Environment Canada said.
Val Marie, Sask., reported a low of 3.2 Celsius (37.8 F) at chest level at 0600 CDT/1100 GMT, and 3.8 Celsius (38.8 F) at 0700 CDT/1200 GMT, meteorologist Gerald Machnee said.
Red Deer, Alta., reported a low of 4.0 Celsius (39.2 F) for two hours.
"At three to four degrees you can get close to zero (freezing) in some spots," Machnee said.
The remainder of the Prairies were 5.6 Celsius or warmer.
Temperatures at ground level can be 2.0 to 5.0 Celsius lower than at chest level depending on windspeed, sky conditions and ground surface moisture.
